p: Fresh vegetables are one of the main components in a healthy and balanced diet, as they are high in dietary fiber and phytonutrients with low fat content and calories. However, when exposed to adverse handling and storage conditions, vegetables (especially minimally processed) tend to have short shelf life due to deterioration of their quality attributes. The use of natural products on fresh commodities and minimally processed fruit and vegetables has been previously studied by researchers and the outcomes are promising [ 14, 15, 17, 30, 32, 48, 49, 50], but most importantly are well appreciated by the consumers. In the present work, the effects of the application of marjoram EO, chitosan, AA, and their combinations were assessed regarding the quality attributes of fresh-cut lettuce, indicating an alternative preservation postharvest management for quality and safe stored products.
